result.execSummary:
The defendant Paul Gilbert Martinez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay all applicable court costs and fees by 4/14/16, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.

Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 15 days time served. The Court granted Huber privileges, pursuant to 303.08 Wis. Stats. for work. Court stayed sentence to 10/16/15 at 5pm.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Paul Gilbert Martinez

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the state, court ordered the repeater enhancer as to count 1 dismissed.

Defendant Paul Gilbert Martinez in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.

ENTRY MADE WITHOUT THE COURT FILE. 
Defendant Paul Gilbert Martinez in court. 
Present in court is Justice Point/WCS Case Worker Jennifer Hoffman  Case was in court due to violation.  
Justice Point worker  informed the court that prior to coming to Intake Court to address the violation, defendant's prescription medication was verified, there is no violationfor the court  to address and defendant is in compliance. 
Case remains calendared for October 14, 2015 at 8:15am  in Branch 38.

Defendant Paul Gilbert Martinez in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case adjourned to 10-14-2015 at 8:15a.m. in Branch 38 for GUILTY PLEA/sentencing. 
Defendant is currently in parenting classes.  Statement by Myra M.  The court will allow for third party contact with child.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Paul Gilbert Martinez in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pretrial Conference held off the record.  Discovery received by defense counsel.  Offer will be forthcoming, per the State.  Case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 38 on 8-20-2015 at 8:15 am.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.   mld
from Justice Point, received and filed.   mld

15RM034181  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
07/17/2015
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with EIM D.O.B 11/4/2012, unless supervised by the Bureau of Milwaukee Child Welfare.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Paul Gilbert Martinez in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Paul Gilbert Martinez in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bvj  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  Defense raises motion to dismiss due to lack of probable cause. Arguments heard. Court denies motion to dismiss. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Paul Gilbert Martinez in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Paul Gilbert Martinez in custody.  William Patrick Pipp appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case passed due to ADA Not having DA's  file.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
